strategy: Adepta Sororitas armies have a Strategy Rating of 3.
Initiative: Ordo Hereticus and the Imperial Navy formations have an Initiative Rating of 2+. All other formations have an Initiative of 1+.

sections.name: Adepta Sororita Support Formations
sections.description: Two Adepta Sororitas Support Formations may be taken per Adepta Sororitas Core Formation

formations.name: Exorcism
extraUnits: Replace four Exorcist Prioris with four Exorcist Sanctorum: Free

formations.name: Immolation
formations.units: Three Celestian Sisters, three Sororitas Immolators

formations.name: Retribution
formations.units: Four Retributor Sisters, two Sororitas Repressors

formations.name: Repentance
formations.units: Four Repentia Sisters, two Sororitas Repressors

sections.name: Ordo Hereticus Formations
sections.description: Two Ordo Hereticus Formations may be taken per Adepta Sororitas Core Formation

formations.name: 0-1 Ordo Hereticus Inquisitor Retinue
formations.units: One Ordo Hereticus Inquisitor, five Storm Troopers, three Chimeras
extraUnits: Replace three Chimeras with three Valkyries: 25 points
Add up to three Hellhounds: 25 points each

formations.name: Flagellant
extraUnits: Add up to two Penitent Engines: 35 points each

formations.name: Redemption
formations.units: One Ministorum Priest, eight Redemptionists, four Ordo Hereticus Land Transporters

sections.name: Imperial Navy Formations
sections.description: Up to a fourth of the points available may be spent on Imperial Navy formations

upgrades.title: Upgrades
upgrades.description: Each upgrade may be taken once per formation

options.description: Replace a Palatine with a Cannoness (Mission only)
Replace the Ordo Hereticus Inquisitor with an Ordo Hereticus Inquisitor Lord (Ordo Hereticus Inquisitor Retinue only)

items.name: Living Saint (0-1 per army)
items.description: Replace a Palatine and its unit with a Living Saint

items.name: Exorcists
items.description: Replace two units of Battle Sisters with two Exorcist Prioris

options.description: You must take exactly enough to carry all units in the formation after any upgrades have been added. No transport spaces may be left over if possible
Add any number of Sororitas Immolators
Add any number of Sororitas Repressors
Add any number of Sororitas Rhinos

usage: v1.0.0: This list is based on the E-UK version, but with a number of changes to balance the choices in the list, and reduce the potential for spamming Mission / Exorcist formations. The overall structure is a lot more rigid, the Act of Faith rule has been changed to make it more thematic, and reinforce the list's aggressive playstyle, and it is possible to take more Inquisitorial support formations, which is intended to make it possible to play the list more like a Ordo Hereticus army.

Some other major changes: The basic Battle Sisters unit now has a Heavy Bolter instead of the Heavy Flamer, while the Exorcist has had its stats changed to make it more of a support formation instead of a main battle tank. It is also possible to take them in their 'Whirlwind' configuration. Most infantry unit types have their own dedicated formations, instead of being spread out across the army. This makes each formation a bit more unique, but also makes it easier to remember what each type of 'sister' does, which can be quite confusing for an opponent. The 'Emperor's Chapel' unit has been added to give the army a thematically appropriate WE unit and the Mission formations a bit more staying power. The Exorcists are also easier to integrate into these formations. The Repressor and the Immolator has been made a bit more attractive compared to the basic Rhino, which is no longer free. The Lightning Strike Fighter has been given slightly different stats.
